page.title: 09St.Helens 150th Anniversary.
page.content: St.Helen's School was 150 years old in July 1985. We all dressed up in Victorian costume. We walked to school quickly trying not to notice the eyes staring at us. The bell rang so we all lined up to go to church. The vicar took a Victorian service and then we went back to school for lessons in the 3'R'S'-reading,writing and arithmetic. In the afternoon we had a Victorian sports day, planted a tree, played old fashioned games and, best of all a picnic with a very big cake which one of the parents donated. At the end we sang old songs.We had a wonderful time and for once this year, a lovely warm day. The next day we did all Victorian lessons and our teacher was very strict. It was rather frightening especially as he had a big stick.
